meanings.def: not wet or sticky; without water or moisture
examples: Is my shirt dry yet?
Store onions in a cool dry place.
I'm afraid this cake has turned out very dry.
Some plants grow better in dry soil.
When the paint is completely dry, apply another coat.
We managed to stay dry by huddling in a doorway.
Her mouth felt as dry as a bone (= completely dry).
It was high summer and the rivers were dry (= had no water in them).
He towelled himself dry.
Rinse the mushrooms and pat dry.
Ruth felt her mouth go dry.
This type of wound is best kept dry without a dressing.
The ink was barely dry on the agreement before fighting broke out again.

meanings.def: with very little rain
examples: weeks of hot, dry weather
the dry season
I hope it stays dry for our picnic.
There is every prospect of the weather remaining dry this week.
Rattlesnakes occur in the warmer, drier parts of North America.
The day will start bright and mainly dry.
New Zealand has hot, dry summers and cold winters.
A doctor suggested they move to the drier climate of Arizona.
The coming weekend will be warm and dry.

meanings.def: without the natural oils that makes it soft and healthy
examples: a shampoo for dry hair

meanings.def: that does not produce any phlegm (= the thick liquid that forms in the nose and throat)
examples: a dry hacking cough

meanings.def: eaten on its own without any butter, jam, etc.
examples: Breakfast consisted of dry bread and a cup of tea.

meanings.def: not sweet
examples: a crisp dry white wine
a dry sherry
This wine is too dry for me.

meanings.def: very clever and expressed in a quiet way that is not obvious; often using irony
examples: He was a man of few words with a delightful dry sense of humour.
He quickly built up a reputation for his dry wit.

meanings.def: not showing emotion
examples: a dry voice
‘He may not last the night,’ she said in a dry tone.
He replied in a cold, dry manner.

meanings.def: not interesting
examples: Government reports tend to make dry reading.
They were conducting a dry debate on science policy.

meanings.def: without alcohol; where it is illegal to buy, sell or drink alcohol
examples: We had a dry wedding (= no alcoholic drinks were served).
a dry county/state
He's been dry (= has drunk no alcohol) for a year now.

meanings.def: thirsty; that makes you thirsty
examples: I'm a bit dry.
This is dry work.

meanings.def: to have done something successfully, especially when it was difficult
examples: I could see the finish line and thought I was home and dry.

meanings.def: to take away all somebody’s money
examples: The big corporations are bleeding some of these small countries dry.

meanings.def: in a position out of the water
examples: Their yacht was left high and dry on a sandbank.

meanings.def: in a difficult situation, without help or money
to remain ready for a possible emergency
to get from somebody/something all the money, help, information, etc. they have, usually giving nothing in return
examples: By earning millions from racing and giving pennies back, the bookmakers are sucking the sport dry.

meanings.def: used to say that everyone was very emotional about something
examples: There wasn't a dry eye in the house when they announced their engagement.

meanings.def: to stop supplying water; to be all used so that none is left
examples: The wells in most villages in the region have run dry.
Vaccine supplies started to run dry as the flu outbreak reached epidemic proportions.
Native resources of scientific talent and ingenuity have not run dry.

meanings.def: to get as much money, information, etc. out of somebody as you can

meanings.def: to become dry; to make something dry
examples: He did the laundry and hung it out to dry.
Be careful. The paint hasn't dried yet.
You wash the dishes and I'll dry.
dry something Use this towel to dry your hands.
to dry your hair
First, wash and dry the vegetables.
to dry your eyes/tears (= stop crying)
Allow the paper to dry overnight.
Always dry clothes thoroughly before you wear them again.
It's best to let your hair dry naturally.
I carefully dried the lettuce with a paper towel.
I dried my hands on the towel.

meanings.def: to put somebody in a difficult situation
examples: She is being hung out to dry for one silly mistake.

idioms.def: to put somebody in a difficult situation
examples: She is being hung out to dry for one silly mistake.
